catFacts.fact: A cat can jump up to six times its length in a single bound.
Cats use their whiskers to determine if a space is too small to squeeze through.
Cats are able to make over 100 different vocal sounds, while dogs can only make about 10.
Cats have five toes on their front paws, but only four toes on their back paws.
A catâ€™s heart beats nearly twice as fast as a human heart, at a rate of 110 to 140 beats per minute.
